file_content.text: You need to get to Combo before Rogun's men.
Ah, what a moment for the holo-albums. Standing with two of the galaxy's most famous... or should I say "notorious" spacers.
Captain, I'd like to introduce you to Vaz Traniff. He's, ah, how do I say this delicately...?
I rob ships.
I thought you'd appreciate knowing that more than one of his hits has been against Rogun the Butcher.
Wish I could have been there to see that.
Nice work.
I'm the last one who was that's still standing.
Is this guy here to go after Rogun?
What is this about?
Not exactly....
Hasn't anybody killed that guy yet?
Rogun again?
Never got close enough to try.
That mug's been coming after my crew since the last job we pulled on him. Picked 'em off one by one.
I remember this guy. I think he was ahead of you on Rogun's "whose face I want to smash in personally" list.
Now the Hutts have my best vault cracker. We don't stop them, they'll sell him to Rogun for the price of his head.
What's this "we"?
If "we" don't stop them?
If it's a chance to hurt Rogun, I'm on board.
Count me in.
It's more.
That's your problem.
Vaz's partner, Combo, was taken by the Hutts while doing preliminary scouting for what could be the heist of the millennium.
An Imperial treasury starship, the King's Ransom, is in orbit just off Nar Shaddaa. I don't have to tell you the kind of credits we're talking about.
You don't have to... but I'd love to hear those numbers.
Ooh, that'd be hitting those Imperial thugs where it hurts.
A risky target.
Imperial treasury ships are well-guarded. But if one were taken, it would drive a wedge between the bureaucracy and the military.
Rogun's never had the guts to go after an Imperial treasury ship directly.
You could be righteous and rich. I figured you'd want in.
What kind of haul are we talking about?
How rich?
My understanding is this ship is carrying the product of all trade between the Empire and the Hutts on Nar Shaddaa.
Help me rescue Combo, raid the ship, and we'll split it fifty-fifty.
You know me so well.
[Flirt] You were right.
My dear, if you declined the chance to thumb your nose at both Rogun and the Empire while rolling in credits, you and I would be through.
I changed my mind. Let's not do this.
I'm always ready to kill a few Imperials for the cause. The cause being getting me lots and lots of money.
You were right.
We'll split the haul fifty-fifty. But we need to rescue Combo, first.
I need to know more, first.
Combo's my best code cracker. Cuts through Imperial security like a vibroblade through bantha fat.
We get him from the Hutts, we can hit the King's Ransom before she leaves orbit. Split the haul fifty-fifty.
It's not often you get the chance to thumb your nose at Rogun, strike a blow for the Republic and still walk away with enough to retire on.
You don't have to lay it on so thick. I'm in.
All right. I'll do it.
You wouldn't have come to Darmas if you could do this yourself. Sixty-forty.
Why fifty-fifty?
Darmas wouldn't have introduced us if he thought you could do it alone. Fifty.
I'm sure you two will work out the details.
What's the Hutts' role in all this?
Who are we taking on?
They want the bounty Rogun put on me and Combo. No personal stakes.
Rogun's got a rocky history with the Hutts. There's nothing holding them together that a higher bid can't undo.
Rogun's lieutenant Strilth is going to pick Combo up at a Hutt Cartel safe house on Nar Shaddaa. Vaz has the coordinates.
I'll meet you there. If we don't manage to rescue Combo, deal's off.
So good to catch you in, Captain.
I trust you're finished playing white knight to poor little smugglers?
If you're finding yourself at loose ends now, a business opportunity has presented itself that I thought might interest you.
Why do I suspect this "opportunity" will involve me getting shot at...
I bet it's not that easy.
No risk, no reward, right?
It takes credits to maintain this lifestyle.
I could use some money.
I assure you, this job promises to be quite profitable.
What kind of opportunity?
It's not the kind of thing you talk about on an open line.
Why don't you meet me at Port Nowhere, and we can discuss it?
It's been a while since we've gotten to chat... face-to-face.
Perhaps over a game of sabacc?
Well, Captain, I think Senator Dodonna is starting to see the payoff on her investment.
I hear the Nebula prototypes were well-received, and the loss is causing a bit of a dustup among the Imperials down on Balmorra.
You know me, plenty of crackle for the credit.
[Flirt] Of course.
I give up.
My dear, if you were a weapon, it could only be the most incendiary sort.
I'm always happy to have more big guns that aren't pointed at me.
Glad to help.
And the Republic is happy to oblige you.
Those weapons were made by the people of Balmorra. The Republic should give them enough to defend themselves.
The resistance needs it back.
I'll make sure Senator Dodonna is aware of your opinion. But Balmorra is hardly the only target in this war.
Where to next, then?
I believe the Senator is hoping you'll brave Hoth next. It's a frozen wasteland, somewhere in the Outer Rim.
Captain. Senator Dodonna asked me to call you for a progress report.
The Republic's hearing plenty about a missing Imperial munitions shipment, but nothing's turned up at Palliser Station.
It should be arriving at Port Nowhere any moment now.
The shipment's on its way.
Oh, I love the smell of piles of credits....
The shipment's ours. If Dodonna asks, I'll tell her you dared me to steal it.
[Flirt] It was your idea.
Ha! A woman after my own heart.
Wait for a big surprise at Port Nowhere.
I took your advice.
Ha! I knew you'd go there, Captain.
Just tell me where we're heading next.
Forget it.
Ah, too smart to talk on an open link, hmm, Captain? I'm guessing you took my little suggestion?
Well, if the Nebula prototypes somehow turn up here, you don't have to worry about them finding good... and rich... new homes.
In the meantime, the Senator wants you to head to Hoth. Frozen ice chunk off on the Outer Rim.
I don't know the full situation--something about a pirate superweapon--but I'm sure Senator Dodonna will brief you when you arrive. Pack warmly.
